Package core

Class HlaSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.HlaSettings
  • public class HlaSettings
extends java.lang.Object
    Settings for a HlaWorld.

    It is recommended to use the regular configuration mechanism of the application to control the HLA configuration. This should be done by overriding this class, and combine that with the usual configuration mechanism.

    It is possible to override the settings for a HlaWorld by settings the System Property core.settings to a valid Properties file. For example 

    
 java -Dcore.settings=MySettingsFile ...
    where MySettingsFile is the settings file.

    A template for the settings file: 

    
#
# HlaWorld template settings file for a Developer Studio generated federate
#

# CRC host
crcHost = localhost

# CRC port
crcPort = 8989

# Local Settings Designator for HLA 1516-2010 Evolved
localSettingsDesignator = 

# Federate name
federateName = DevStudio

# Federation name
federationName = Federation

# HLA 1516-2000 FOM URL
classicFomURL = 

# Main HLA 1516-2010 Evolved FOM Module URL
evolvedFomURL = combined.xml

# Additional HLA 1516-2010 Evolved FOM Module URLs
additionalFomURLs = 

# HLA 1.3 FED URL
fedURL = 

# Try to create the federation before join
createFederation = true

# Try to destroy the federation after resign
destroyFederation = true

# RTI Profile to use (empty, A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K or N), default when empty is to use the
# first available
rtiDriverProfile = B

# Enable HLA Time Management with time constrained
timeConstrained = true

# Enable HLA Time Management with time regulating
timeRegulating = true

# Step size
stepSize = 1

# HLA Time Management lookahead
lookahead = 1

# Time stamp factory to use (none, system_clock, rpr_relative or rpr_absolute)
timeStampFactory = system_clock

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      HlaSettings()
      Creates a HlaSettings with the default settings and then reads the settings file and updates the settings that are specified in the file.
      HlaSettings​(java.lang.String localSettingsDesignator)
      Creates a HlaSettings with the default settings and then reads the settings file and updates the settings that are specified in the file, finally overrides Local Settings Designator with the value specified here.
      HlaSettings​(java.lang.String crcHost, int crcPort)
      Creates a HlaSettings with the default settings and then reads the settings file and updates the settings that are specified in the file, finally overrides CRC host and CRC port with the values specified here.

        public int getCrcPort()

        the CRC port

      • getLocalSettingsDesignator

        public java.lang.String getLocalSettingsDesignator()
        Get the Local Settings Designator (LSD) for HLA Evolved. The LSD can be used instead of CRC Host and Port to specify CRC to connect to.

        Note that the LSD is only used if connecting to HLA Evolved and to use the default LSD (an empty string), the returned CRC host also has to be an empty string.

        Returns:
        the Local Settings Designator (LSD)

      • getRtiDriverDetectives

        public java.util.List<se.pitch.ral.api.detective.Detective> getRtiDriverDetectives()
        Get the list of RTI Driver Detectives.

        The ability to attach detectives must be used with caution. Misbehaving detectives can cause the entire HlaWorld to misbehave or even crash.

        Returns:
        The RTI Driver Detectives, use null or an empty list to disable detectives.

      • getTimeConstrained

        public boolean getTimeConstrained()
        Get if this federate should be time constrained using HLA Time Management.
        Returns:
        true if this federate should be time constrained

      • getTimeRegulating

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        hlaVersion - the HLA version of the RTI in use
        defaultName - the default class name for the logical time factory
        Returns:
        the logical time factory class name to use.
